shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus” (fols. 5ra-118rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 5ra-10rc) - On John the Evangelist as the author of the book; on the creation and the fall of the angels (fols. 5ra-7vb) - Story of the family of Adam (fols. 7vb-10rc) I-2) Täʾamrä ʾIyäsus “Miracles of Jesus”: 41 (?) miracles (fols. 10rc-118rb)
Colophon.

donors.donor: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus and his mother Wälättä Ṣǝyon are mentioned in supplication formulas and in the colophon. Other persons mentioned are Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus' son Wäldä Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 42vc, 44vbc, 50rb), his father Wäldä Lǝʿul and Wälättä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 36va, 54ra, 85ra). All names were added in a secondary hand.

dcomments.dcomment: Late 19th - 20th century (?). Despite the mention of Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus as the donor (the baptismal name of däğğazmač Subagadis, 1770-1831) and the information in the colophon, the Ms. is palaeographically datable only to a much posterior period, and is probably a copy of a book which was indeed commissioned and donated by Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus/ Subagadis.

txstates.txstate: The front board is cracked and repaired. The sewing is slightly damaged. Holes and tears amended on fols. 58, 93.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and the tail of the codex.

inks.ink: Black, red (vivid scarlet: fols. 5ra-31v, strong red: fols. 33r-52r and 87r-118rb, strong amaranth: fols. 52v-86v).

squires.squire: I(2/fols. 1r-4v) – II(8/fol. 5r-12v) – ፪III(8/fols. 13r-20v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 21r-28v) – ፬V(4/fols. 29r-32v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 33r-40v) – ፯VII(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 5/fols. 41r-45v) – VIII(8/fols. 46r-53v) – ፪IX(8/fols. 54r-61v) – ፫X(8/fols. 62r-69v) – ፬XI(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 70r-76v) – XII(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XIII(8/fols. 85r-92v) – ፩XIV(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 93r-101v) – XV(10/fols. 102r-111v) – XVI(8/fols. 112r-119v).

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The ruling was disregarded and not every line was used: e.g., fols. 31v-32v, 58v-64v. Some fols. have a single marginal line at the top (e.g., fols. 35rv, 38rv,93rv) or at the bottom (e.g., fols. 49r-50v, 87rv, 90r-91r).

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: 20th century script possibly imitating an older rounded broad script.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The involvement of more than one scribe cannot be excluded. The handwriting changes from careful and neat at the very beginning to mediocre (cp. fol. 5r and fol. 34r). Thereafter it appears irregular throughout the Ms. due to varying density of ruling lines and shapes of the letters (cp. quires II-III, V-VI, VI-VII, VII-VIII), mostly from quire to quire, but also within quires: - the letters are irregularly slanted (from upright and slightly right sloping to slightly left sloping) - the size of the letters differs, cp. fols. 32v-33r (quires V-VI), 40v-41r (VI-VII), or fols. 68r and 76v - the thickness of the letters' elements differs, cp. fols. 40v-41r (quire VI-VII) - space between letters significantly differs (broadly spaced, e.g., fols. 25v, 76v against narrowly spaced, e.g., fols. 33r, 46v, 77r) A few distinctive features of the handwriting are discernible throughout the Ms.: - the right loop of ሠ (in all vowel orders) is of very small size - the upper horizontal stroke of መ is always finely and uniformly curved, the loops reach the ruling line - the letters ፅ and ዕ are usually cone-shaped, downward oriented.

rubrications.rubrication: Rubrication is executed in different tones of red: vivid scarlet on fols. 5ra-31v, strong red on fols. 33r-52r and 87r-118rb, strong amaranth: fols. 52v-86v. Nomina sacra; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-1 and incipit of its subsections; incipit of Text I-2, its sections and subsections; some words: kwǝllu "all" (fols. 78vc-79rc), kǝfl "part" (fol. 115rb), mǝʿǝraf "chapter" (e.g., fol. 116vb); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals. The names of the donors, mentioned throughout the Ms., have been added later in a secondary hand in moderate amaranth.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ለ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (e.g., fols. 11vc, 13rb) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 25ra, 108vb) ለዓ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 26rb, 488rb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 25ra) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለ፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fol. 44vb) ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (e.g., fols. 20rb, 85rb)

colophon.tran: Fol. 118rc: In the year of the world 7256, in the ninth year of the death of our king Zä-Mänfäs Qəddus, with his father Wäldä Lǝˁul and his mother, our Queen, Wälättä Ṣǝyon. His regnal name was Zä-Mänfäs. May His grace be upon them and upon us. Amen.
colophon.det: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus is the baptismal name of däğğazmač Subagadis (1770-1831), but the year of the world 7256 corresponds to 1764 A.D. (s. ChChron 169) and is probably mistaken. The note is recent; the scribe used a recent ink (pink) and tried to imitate certain features of the handwriting of the main text (e.g., the form of the characters ፅ, ዕ, መ and ሠ). Possibly, he might have copied colophon that had been in column b (now scratched out).

extras.extra: - Erased note (colophon?) at the end of Text I-2: fol. 118rb. - Erasures: fols. 23v7va, 17rb, 19rc, 25rc, 47vb, 98rc, 99rbc, 101rab. - Corrections written over erased words probably in a secondary hand: e.g., fols. 11vb, 64vc, 66vb, 85rb. - The word qwǝm "stop" or "stand" is written in red: fol. 94rc.

txquiremarks.txquiremark:
- Decorated quire marks for quires III-VII are written in the upper margin, on fols. 13r: ፪, 21r: ፫, 29r: ፬, 33r: ፮ (!), 41r: ፯.
- Undecorated quire marks for quires IX-XI and XIV are written in the upper margin, on fols. 54r: ፪, 62r: ፫, 70r: ፬, 33r: ፮ (!), 94r: ፩.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margin indicate the readings for the parts of the day and Saturdays (the first Sabbath day): e.g., ዘ፱ ሰዓት: fol. 94r ዘሰርክ፡ fol. 95r ዘሰንበተ፡ አይሁድ: fol. 95v.

miniature.info: Fol. 2v: Percussio capitis, a prone figure below (a donor?).

frames.frame: Horizontal ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the middle of the page (started but not finished, and scratched out on fol. 5r?; incipit of Text I-1).
